official_title: KIND network: Welcome to KIND
friendly_title: KIND network: Welcome to KIND
description: An informal introduction to the KIND network, including an overview of the training on offer, the social aspects of the network, and an opportunity for introductions and Q&A. Mainly aimed at recent joiners, but all very welcome.

official_title: KIND community event: SAS overtime dashboard
friendly_title: KIND community event: SAS overtime dashboard
description: In our first community meetup of the year, we're delighted to welcome Heather McBroom (SAS) to introduce their overtime dashboard. All welcome - we won't record this session, but will offer similar sessions in future

official_title: KIND network: BI for Beginners show and tell
friendly_title: KIND network: BI for Beginners show and tell
description: A social session for colleagues who have recently completed our BI for Beginners training, or who are otherwise new to Power BI. Come along, show off your Power BI projects, and get social support, ideas, and help for your next step.

official_title: KIND network: UK Data Service training
friendly_title: KIND network: UK Data Service training
description: Save the date! Delighted to say that Dr Vanessa Higgins from the University of Manchester will be giving us an overview of the training and support available from the UK Data Service

official_title: KIND network: researcher group
friendly_title: KIND network: researcher group
description: This is a social session for researchers, research students, and the research-curious across the KIND community. Come along to meet like-minded colleagues, talk about some of the opportunities and challenges of research in our practice, and decide on future activities. All welcome!

official_title: KIND network: Classifications and Terminologies training materials
friendly_title: KIND network: Classifications and Terminologies training materials
description: Terminology Services are a team based in Public Health Scotland who advise on clinical coding systems used in NHS Scotland, such as ICD-10, OPCS4, and SNOMED CT. They provide training as well as an advisory service for users of coded data. At this session

official_title: KIND network: The Knowledge Network
friendly_title: KIND network: The Knowledge Network
description: The NHSScotland Knowledge Network offers access to a multitude of research platforms and resources where health and social care staff can find the supporting information needed to answer the questions they face. Understanding how to use these effectively can help make the evidence finding journey more manageable.

official_title: KIND network: Copyright 101 - Practical Guidance for Educators, Content Creators and other staff
friendly_title: KIND network: Copyright 101 - Practical Guidance for Educators, Content Creators and other staff
description: A clear, practical introduction to copyright for NHS staff, covering ownership, permissions, fair dealing, and good practice when creating or sharing  material. The session focuses on risk management, real-world examples, and navigating images, licences, and emerging issues such as the use of AI in content creation. You can also find help and support via the copyright pages on TURAS.

official_title: KIND network Errors Week: outgrowing Excel
friendly_title: KIND network Errors Week: outgrowing Excel
description: Excel is universal and familiar but is it always the right tool for the job? How do you know/decide when it's time to make the step away from the limitations of Excel - and how would you go about choosing and moving to an alternative database, based on your data requirements?
